events.title: Battle of New Orleans
events.description: American forces under General Andrew Jackson defeated a British invasion along the Mississippi River; the last major battle of the War of 1812.
events.significance: Boosted American nationalism and propelled Andrew Jackson to national prominence.

events.title: Wilson's Fourteen Points delivered to Congress
events.description: President Woodrow Wilson outlines a plan for postwar diplomacy centered on self-determination, open diplomacy, and the creation of a League of Nations.
events.significance: Influenced post-World War I diplomacy and laid groundwork for the League of Nations.

events.title: Elvis Presley is born
events.description: Elvis Aron Presley, later known as the King of Rock and Roll, is born in Tupelo, Mississippi.
events.significance: A pivotal figure in popularizing rock and roll, shaping modern music and youth culture.

events.title: Stephen Hawking is born
events.description: Stephen William Hawking, eminent theoretical physicist and cosmologist, is born in Oxford, England.
events.significance: Contributed profoundly to our understanding of black holes and cosmology; popularized science worldwide.

events.title: David Bowie is born
events.description: David Bowie, influential English singer-songwriter and actor, is born in London; a key innovator in glam rock and art rock.
events.significance: Expanded the boundaries of popular music and performance, influencing generations of artists.
